verses.verse: For the conclusion, concerning her who obtaineth the inheritance. A Psalm by David. Lord, hear my words; attend to my cry.
Listen to the sound of my prayer, my king and my God! For to thee, Lord, I will pray.
In the morning thou shalt hear my voice: in the morning I will wait on thee and look up.
Because thou art not a God pleased with iniquity; therefore he who is wicked cannot dwell near thee:
nor shall transgressors continue in thy presence. Thou Lord, hatest all the workers of iniquity:
thou wilt destroy all them who speak lies; a bloody and deceitful man the Lord abhorreth.
As for me, I through thine abundant mercy, will go to thy house: I will worship before thy holy temple, in thy fear.
Lead me, Lord, in thy saving goodness: direct my way before thee, because of mine enemies; because there is no truth in their mouth.
Their heart is false; their throat, an open sepulchre: with their tongue they practised deceit.
Judge them, God; let them fall for their devices: according to the multitude of their crimes cast them out; because they have provoked thee, Lord.
But let all, whose hope is in thee, rejoice. They shall exult forever, and thou wilt dwell among them: and all who love thy name will glory in thee;
because thou wilt bless the righteous. Thou, Lord, hast covered us as with armour of favour.
